alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued January 23 at 2:02AM PST until January 23 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM NOON PST TODAY THROUGH 10PM THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Higher threat for sneaker waves expected. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. * WHEN...From noon PST today through 10 pm PST this evening. * IMPACTS...Even during calm conditions, sneaker waves can sweep up the beach without warning and knock unsuspecting people over and pull them out to sea. Shock and hypothermia can occur quickly in the cold Pacific waters. In addition, logs and other debris can be lifted and carried by the waves, crushing or entrapping unsuspecting victims underneath. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Sneaker waves have the ability to run farther up the beach than usual. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
